blocks.title: Help Stop the Spread of COVID-19 in Your Community
list: Get alerted if you recently spent more than 10 minutes within 6 feet of someone who tests positive.
Alert others if you test positive.
Keep an eye on trends in your community.

introduction.disclaimer: **We don’t collect info that can identify you. The app never tracks your location.**

permissions.title: Set Up Closeness Sensing for COVID Alerts
permissions.line1: This app needs your permission to:
permissions.track:
**Sense when another phone with this app is close by.**

If another app user spends 10 minutes within 6 feet of you, your phones swap random codes to remember the contact. These codes don't say anything about you or your location.
permissions.notifications:
**Send you notifications.**

If the other app user tests positive for the virus within the next few days, the app can send you a COVID Alert after checking your codes.
permissions.subtitle: The app never:
permissions.statement: You can change your mind at any time by going to App Settings.

tour.title: How It Works
statements:
As you go about your day, the app uses Bluetooth to sense when you spend more than 10 minutes within 6 feet of another person with the app.

This is “close contact”. It’s long enough and close enough for you to catch the virus.

The app ignores people who just pass by or stand more than 6 feet away from you. You’ll never get any alerts because of them.

When your app senses the close contact, your phone exchanges a secure random code with the other person’s phone. Your phone stores this close contact code in a list.

The codes are random and don’t reveal any information about you or the other person. The app doesn’t collect or share any names, locations, or phone numbers.

If you test positive for COVID-19, a public health representative will call you as soon as possible.

The representative will ask if you’re willing to share your app’s list of close contact codes to help protect other people.

Sharing your list is secure and private. The app never reveals who you are to anyone.

Each day, every phone that has the app compares its own list of close contact codes to the list of "infected" codes.

If there's a match, the app will display a COVID Alert.

intro.title: With COVID Alert NY you can do 3 things to help fight COVID-19:

view1.title: Contact Tracing
view1.text: Help contact tracing, protecting your privacy.

view3.title: Updates
view3.text: Keep up to date on the fight against COVID-19.

view4.text: If you tap Get started, you are accepting the

information.title: Contact Tracing
information.highlight: Contact tracing helps prevent the spread of COVID-19.
information.highlight1: This app supports the work of the DOH’s Contact Tracing teams, but those teams may also contact you as part of manual contact tracing.
information.text: The app will send you a Close Contact Alert if you have been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for the virus.
information.text1: To enable Contact Tracing for this app you need to turn on:
information.text2: and to get an alert you need to turn on:
information.quote: If you change your mind, you can change your permissions in Settings at any time.

checker.title: My Health Log

symptoms.subtitle: Do you have any of the following 11 symptoms today?
symptoms.fever: Fever or feeling feverish (such as chills, sweating)
symptoms.breath: Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
symptoms.taste: New loss of taste or smell

results.title: Thank you
results.noSymptomsFeelingWell:
**Thank you for today's log. We're glad to hear you're feeling well!**

Even if you still feel OK, please come back tomorrow to let us know how you're doing.
results.riskGroup:
Because of your age, we would like you to take extra care to protect yourself from COVID-19.

We know this isn't an easy time. If you need support or advice on how to manage at home, tap below for more information.
results.noSymptomsNotFeelingWell:
**Thank you for today's log. We're sorry to hear you're not feeling well.**

Fortunately, you didn't report many symptoms. If you continue to feel unwell or get any new symptoms, talk to your health care provider or call the COVID Alert NY Hotline at [1-833-227-5045](tel:18332275045).

For NYC: Call the Test & Trace COVID Hotline for more information or to find a NYC test site.
[212-COVID19 (212-268-4319)](tel:12122684319)

If you'd like to get tested, contact your health provider or schedule an appointment at a publicly accessible testing site. 
[Find a site near you.](https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/find-test-site-near-you)

Please remember to come back tomorrow to let us know how you're doing.
results.coronavirus1:
**We're sorry to hear you're not feeling well. Unfortunately, the symptoms you've reported today may be signs of COVID-19.**

If your symptoms are mild, remember that most people can recover at home without medical care.

However, we recommend that anyone with COVID-19 symptoms should take the following steps to protect the health of themselves and others:

**Please stay at home.** Avoid contact with other people (even your family) to help keep them from getting sick.

**Contact a health care provider.**
Call your doctor or the COVID Alert NY Hotline at [1-833-227-5045](tel:18332275045)

For NYC: Call the Test & Trace COVID Hotline for more information or to find a NYC test site.
[212-COVID19 (212-268-4319)](tel:12122684319)

**Get tested.** Talk to your health care provider or schedule an appointment at a publicly accessible testing site. 

[Find a site near you.](https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/find-test-site-near-you)
results.callEmergency:
If it's an emergency,
call 911 right away.
results.coronavirus2:
Signs of an emergency include:

  * Trouble breathing
  * Persistent pain or pressure in the chest
  * New confusion
  * Inability to wake or stay awake
  * Bluish lips or face
results.callHelp:
If you need more help,
call COVID Alert NY Hotline

checker.introOptional: All responses are optional and anonymous. The info is used only for public health analysis.
checker.noresults: You haven't tried the symptom checker yet. Start now by tapping the button above

welcome.text:
My Health Log lets you keep track of your own health by storing a history of your symptoms.

The anonymous daily logs from you and other app users help public health researchers understand how the virus is affecting NYS.

**This does not reveal your identity.**
welcome.letUsKnow:
Let us know if you have
symptoms today

status.title: Status
status.intro: To change the status, tap the “Update Settings” button below to go to your phone’s settings.

clearData.title: COVID Alerts
clearData.intro: Your phone keeps a record of all the COVID Alerts you’ve received. To delete all of your past COVID Alerts, tap the “Delete All” button below.
clearData.confirmText: Are you sure you want to clear all your COVID Alerts?
clearData.error: There was an error clearing your COVID Alerts. Please try again.

leave.title: Delete My Data
leave.info:
Thank you for helping us fight the spread of COVID-19 in NY. We’re sorry to see you go, but you can stop using this app at any time.

When you tap the “Delete My Data” button below, we’ll remove all the data that the app stored on your phone, such as all entries in your health log.

summary.android:
**Note:**

This button doesn’t delete the random codes created or collected by your phone for Closeness Sensing and COVID Alerts.

To delete the random codes, go to your phone’s Settings and select “Google Services & Preferences.” Then, select “COVID-19 Exposure Notifications” and tap the “Delete Random IDs” button. To stop storing new codes, you should turn off “Use Exposure Notifications.”
summary.ios:
**Note:**

This button doesn’t delete the random codes created or collected by your phone for Closeness Sensing and COVID Alerts.

To delete the random codes, you must go to your phone’s Settings and search for “Exposure Logging”. Then, select “COVID-19 Exposure Logging” and tap on the “Delete Exposure Log” button. To stop storing new codes, you should turn off “Exposure Logging”.

leave.confirmText: Are you sure you want to delete your data?
leave.error: There was an error deleting your data. Please try again or contact us.

followUpCall.title: Contact Tracing follow-up call
followUpCall.intro: If someone you've been in close contact with tests positive for COVID-19, the app will send you a Close Contact Alert. The DOH will also phone you if you provide your number below.
followUpCall.note:
The DOH may also phone if you are identified as a close contact by manual contact tracing. The DOH will give you advice and refer you for testing if appropriate.

The app will only share your phone number with the DOH if you get a Close Contact Alert. You can enter your number below, or add it later in Settings.
followUpCall.noteAlt:
If someone you've been in close contact with tests positive for COVID-19, the app will send you a Close Contact Alert. The DOH will also phone you if you provide your number below.

The DOH may also phone if you are identified as a close contact by manual contact tracing. The DOH will give you advice and refer you for testing if appropriate.

The app will only share your phone number with the DOH if you get a Close Contact Alert. You can enter your number below.
followUpCall.noteSettings:
If you want we will try to call you to provide further assistance after you receive an exposure notification.

Your phone number will only be shared with the DOH if you get an exposure notification.

closeContact.title: COVID Alert
closeContact.intro:
**The app has detected that on September 1st 2020 someone who tested positive for COVID-19 was too close to you for too long.**

To protect others it would be best to **stay at home**.

A Health Advisor can help you find support for staying at home and getting a test.
closeContact.infoCard: Learn how to keep others safe

underAge.title: COVID Alert
underAge.intro:
**We can’t call you back because you’re too young.**

You must be 18 years or older to let us collect personal information like your phone number.

Instead, you can:

closeContactInfo.title: How to Keep Others Safe
closeContactInfo.info: **To limit the risk of spreading COVID-19 to your family and community, please take the following precautions until you’ve been cleared by a medical professional:**
closeContactInfo.list:
1. **Stay home.**
Stay home except to seek medical care and get a COVID test.

2. **Call ahead if you must leave to get health care.**
Wear a face mask when you go and avoid using public transportation such as subways, buses, taxis.

3. **Separate yourself.**
Stay in a room that is not shared with others and keep your door closed. Sleep by yourself. Stay at least 6 feet away from others at all times, even your family.

4. **Don’t have visitors.**
Keep others from entering without your permission.

5. **Use a separate bathroom.**
If not possible, clean and disinfect all surfaces after each use.

6. **Have food brought to you.**
Arrange for food, medicine, and other supplies to be left at your door.

7. **Cover your coughs and sneezes.**
Throw away used tissues. Bag your trash and leave outside your door. (No special handling is needed.)

8. **Don’t touch pets.**

9. **Arrange for others to care for your children, if possible.**

10. **Wash your hands** often with soap and water for 20 seconds each time, or if unavailable, use hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol. Use paper towels instead of shared towels.

11. **Get tested.**
Talk to your healthcare provider to schedule an appointment.
[Find a site near you](https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/find-test-site-near-you).

12. **Monitor your temperature and symptoms carefully.**
You can keep track of them in the "My Health Log" feature of this app or another way. A daily log helps public health representatives figure out the next steps if you get sick.

13. **Call the Hotline.**
Call the COVID Alert NY Hotline for more information or to schedule a test at a NYS test site.
[1-833-227-5045](tel:18332275045)
  
For NYC: Call the Test & Trace COVID Hotline for more information or to find a NYC test site.
[212-COVID19 (212-268-4319)](tel:12122684319)

closeContactAlert.intro: **The app has detected that on {{exposureDate}} someone who tested positive for COVID-19 was within 6 feet of you for over 10 minutes.**
closeContactAlert.info:
**What do I do now?**

You have received an alert because you have been in contact with someone with COVID-19. There may be a risk you’ll develop COVID-19, so you should quarantine yourself at home, talk to your doctor, and call the COVID Alert NY Hotline to find out how to protect yourself and others.
closeContactAlert.list:
1. **Get tested.**
Talk to your healthcare provider to schedule an appointment.
[Find a site near you](https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/find-test-site-near-you).

2. **Call the Hotline.**
Call the COVID Alert NY Hotline for more information or to schedule a test at a NYS test site.
[1-833-227-5045](tel:18332275045)
   
For NYC: Call the Test & Trace COVID Hotline for more information or to find a NYC test site.
[212-COVID19 (212-268-4319)](tel:12122684319)

3. **Stay home.**
Stay home for 14 days except to seek medical care and get a COVID test.

4. **Call ahead if you must leave to get health care.**
Wear a face mask when you go and avoid using public transportation such as subways, buses, taxis.

5. **Separate yourself.**
Stay in a room that is not shared with others and keep your door closed. Sleep by yourself. Stay at least 6 feet away from others at all times, even your family.

6. **Don’t have visitors.**
Keep others from entering without your permission.

7. **Use a separate bathroom.**
If not possible, clean and disinfect all surfaces after each use.

8. **Have food brought to you.**
Arrange for food, medicine, and other supplies to be left at your door.

9. **Cover your coughs and sneezes.**
Throw away used tissues. Bag your trash and leave outside your door. (No special handling is needed.)

10. **Don’t touch pets.**

11. **Arrange for others to care for your children, if possible.**

12. **Wash your hands** often with soap and water for 20 seconds each time, or if unavailable, use hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol. Use paper towels instead of shared towels.

13. **Monitor your temperature and symptoms carefully.**
You can keep track of them in the "My Health Log" feature of this app or another way. A daily log helps public health representatives figure out the next steps if you get sick.
closeContactAlert.infoCard: Learn how to keep others safe

Please tap “Share” on that screen to upload your records.

uploadSuccess.thanks:
Thank you for sharing your codes. You may have just saved many people in your community from getting COVID-19.

Your public health representative will offer support and do their best to help you plan what to do next. They’ll check in with you daily to see how you’re doing.

appUsage.title: App Metrics
appUsage.info:
The DOH would like to understand your use of the App for the purpose of improving it.

The app will collect anonymous metrics about how you use the app and the effectiveness of Contact Tracing processes.

This information is gathered by the DOH directly and does not use any third parties to gather metrics. **This information is only gathered with your consent and cannot be used to identify you.**
appUsage.settingsInfo: If you change your mind, you can change these permissions in Settings at any time.

metrics.title: Help Improve This App
metrics.info:
You can help the New York State Department of Health improve this app by sharing data about how you use it and how well Closeness Sensing is working.

**When you turn this setting on**, the app sends your usage data directly to the New York State Department of Health. The data is anonymous -- the app doesn’t send anything about your identity. No third parties collect or see any of this data.

**If you keep this setting off or turn it off later**, the app keeps your usage data private and doesn’t send it to anyone.

positiveResult.title: If You Test Positive for COVID-19
positiveResult.text1: If you test positive for COVID-19, the first thing you should do is **stay at home for 14 days** and **isolate yourself** to keep others safe.
positiveResult.text2:
A public health representative will call you as soon as possible. They’ll offer you help with getting medical attention and dealing with challenges you may face, such as how to get food and medicine while you’re isolating.

The representative will also ask if you’re willing to share your app’s list of close contact codes. If so, the app can send an anonymous COVID Alert to other app users who recently spent more than 10 minutes within 6 feet of you.

Sharing your list is secure and private. The app never reveals who you are to anyone.

active.title: Closeness Sensing and COVID Alerts are active!
active.text: Thank you for doing your part to stop the spread of COVID-19.
active.shareText:
Share this app with friends.
Help keep NY Safe.

notEnabledIOS.title: Closeness Sensing is not enabled
notEnabledIOS.text:
To turn on Closeness Sensing, you must enable COVID-19 Exposure Notifications in App Settings.

You should also go to Privacy > Health in your device's settings and make sure COVID-19 Exposure Logging is on.

notActive.title: Closeness Sensing is not active

ios.text: You need to enable Exposure Notifications services and Bluetooth to enable Closeness Sensing
ios.ens:
To turn on Closeness Sensing, you must enable COVID-19 Exposure Notifications in App Settings.

You should also go to Privacy > Health in your device's settings and make sure COVID-19 Exposure Logging is on.

Please turn on Bluetooth.

**Note:** Turn this on in your device’s settings, not by tapping the Bluetooth button in the Control Center.

submitFeedback.title: Submit Feedback
submitFeedback.intro: What type of feedback would you like to submit?
submitFeedback.disclaimer:
**NOTE:** This is for technical feedback only and will be shared with our app developers.

If you are feeling sick or have general questions about COVID-19, please do not use this feedback option and call the COVID Alert NY Hotline instead at [1-833-227-5045](tel:18332275045)

For NYC: Call the Test & Trace COVID Hotline for more information or to find a NYC test site. 
[212-COVID19 (212-268-4319)](tel:12122684319)

ageCheck.intro: I am over 18, or I am the parent or guardian of a minor confirming that they can use the app.
